I'm involved on a project as the QA.  To improve my development 
skills an=
d my JUnit skills, I am writing some JUnit tests.  Today, I 
found that the=
 developer had implemented System.exit(n) throughout 
the application whene=
ver there was a trapped exception.

Now, the requirements call for the appl=
ication to return some exit 
code telling any downstream processes whether =
this application was 
100% successful with no warnings (rc=3D0), 100% succe=
ssful with 
warnings (rc=3D4), not successful at all (rc=3D8).  However, th=
e only 
java mechanism for reporting return codes is System.exit(n), based =
on 
my use of Google.

My JUnit dilemma then, is that System.exit(n) gives =
the required 
application behavior but doesn't seem to be good for running =
JUnit 
tests from a test suite since System.exit(n) ends the JVM.

Does any=
one have any insights they can share?  Since this is my first 
post to this=
 forum, I'm happy to Google some more if you'll only give 
me some keyword =
hint(s) beyond what I've already tried:  "java exit 
code".

Thanks!
